alert.note: Alert for Giles; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Maury; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lewis, southeastern Wayne, Marshall, Lawrence, Maury and Giles Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Mount Pleasant, or 12 miles south of Columbia, moving southwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lewisburg, Lawrenceburg, Pulaski, Mount Pleasant, Loretto, Summertown, Ardmore, Cornersville, St. Joseph, Elkton, Minor Hill, Ethridge, Lynnville, Henryville, Culleoka, Belfast, Goodspring, Leoma and Frankewing. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 1 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Giles; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Maury; Wayne
